availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Carter County Sct
At a circuit Court commenced and held in and for the County of Carter at the Court house in Grayson the 3rd day of October 1865

The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plf
against } Robry
Joseph A Young Deft

This day came the atty for the Commonwealth of Ky and the deft appeared in discharge of his Recognance and the arraignment being dispensed with plead not Gilty and there upon came a Jury (To wit) James Burchete David Mockalice Elihu Boggs Wm Carter Moses Shafer Henry Easterling Isom Roe Calvin Carnafax Thomas Glancy John Y Montgomery Lewis pope & Isaac Burton being Elected tried & Sworn

I certify that the foregoing List of Jurors are is a true copy of the names of the Jury that tried Joseph A. Young in Said Court for Robery and convicted him and sentenced him to the penatentiary for one year --
E P Davis Clk c c c
